patient_information: 21-year-old pregnant woman, 32 weeks gestation (first pregnancy), from The Gambia. No significant past medical history. Otherwise well.
history_of_present_illness: Patient complained of a generalized, non-itchy rash for 5 days. She is 32 weeks pregnant with her first pregnancy and is otherwise well with no significant past medical history.
physical_exam: Generalized macular rash involving the palms of both hands. Mouth is normal, no lymphadenopathy, not anaemic or jaundiced. General examination is unremarkable.
differential_diagnosis: Syphilis (considered the most likely diagnosis given the rash characteristics).
management_and_clinical_course: The patient was treated with a single intramuscular (IM) dose of benzathine penicillin. She made an uneventful recovery and delivered a normal infant at term. Due to treatment occurring after 28 weeks gestation, it was recommended that her infant receive a course of treatment for congenital syphilis (IM procaine penicillin 50000 units/kg daily for 10â€“14 days).
final_diagnosis: Syphilis (secondary stage, based on clinical presentation).
